Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	And now begins the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, students, I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, because of its completion and because of its explanations and because of its declarations, I believe that I have completed what I promised to you in this treatise, which is part of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The operation of amputation has been completely absent from our region and from our time, until quite recently when the science of it was rediscovered, and its proof was established; and no one knew about it except a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which were mostly lost and led to those errors and uncertainties until the understanding of it was established and its length was extended and its art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I believe that I have lived up to the order of this treatise in the second way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and because it comes with the forms of the tools of cautery and of the other instruments of the work, which is necessary for addition to the declaration, and for its preparation.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	If the reason why one is not a good artist in their own craft in our time is because the art of medicine is long, and that it requires one to be exercised in the science of anatomy, which was recently rediscovered by Galen who knew the important parts of the members and their forms, and their conjunction and separation; and had knowledge of the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their number, and their hardness; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the locations of their emissions.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for that reason, called Hippocrates, who said that one name is not enough, but more so in the work itself, and especially in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	Moreover, we have already said about him in the introduction of this book; for those who do not know what we have said about anatomy, they will not avoid falling into error by which many men have died, as I have seen too many of them, because they are formed in this science and get their knowledge from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	When I saw a doctor who was folly and had incurred an abscess called hydrocephalus in the head of a woman, and had incised some arteries of the head so that great pus flowed into it, causing the woman to die among her companions.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who almost choked on a stone from a man who had swallowed it in his state, and the stone was large, and he came to him and tried to remove that stone with a thin tube, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I had already called for help to extract that one, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the position of the patient, it was known that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took a fee from a duke of our land for surgery, and went to a very skilled blacksmith who was needed for the fracture in his thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture, on the wound, with pliers and strong structures, and did not let the wound breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Approach the dressing according to his wishes, and approach the bandage, and approach the ointment for several days and give orders that it be removed; and during this time, the dressing and the foot will become infected, and reach a critical state.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you are called to him, and prepare to remove the bandage, and achieve calmness and ease of his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the decay was already confirmed in the member, so it could not be stopped and did not cease to spread the decay in the member until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And another doctor came who pierced an abscess with cancer, and it became ulcerated soon, until the fire magnified the evil of him and he died.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason is that the cranium is pure of melancholic humor, so it does not allow it to reach him with all iron, but rather the member that suffers from all should be held.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for that reason, children, it is necessary for you to operate in two different ways: one in the operation that is associated with health, and the other in the work that is performed in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already seen that in this book, wherever there is an operation involving error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard against that and lay aside the other, so that the fools do not come to speak to you and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And then take your weapons with solicitude and protection from God, and your patients with patience and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method by the grace of God for their salvation and praiseworthy succession, and lay aside the terrible illnesses that cannot be cured, and keep your weapons from that which causes you to fear, so that your faith remains in you and does not abandon you: because more will remain to your glory, and more in the world and after to your sanctity.

“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a bad patient, because evil doctors will not be remembered.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already dedicated this book to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and the first of the first section.

De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of pointed cautery and sharp medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	That you know the quality of those points of that cautery and of its nozzles, and in what condition it is prohibited to use cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, the speech about the quality of the cauterizing needle and its handle is long and elaborate, and subtle for the knowledgeable, and secretly hidden; and from there they have spoken much about wisdoms, and they have been disagreed upon, and a little of their speeches remains with me, due to length.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that the cauterizing needle corresponds to the entire comprehensive material or its materials, except for two materials, which are tail materials.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the tail material, they disagree; for one said that the cauterizing needle is beneficial for it, and the others said the opposite of that, which is not convenient in illness because of its quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is not convenient that illness be cured with that which is cauterized and dried.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And they said that one who said the opposite of that, which is beneficial for cauterizing in all illness tail material that exists in the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of a man and its humidity to the comprehensive material of fire, the body of a man is pierced.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I heard from that person's mouth that he had experienced this some time ago.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But he may not know that this has been extracted and exercised in the capital of cautery by previous practice, and has recognized the diversity of the composition of men and the disposition of their diseases in their bodies, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the time span of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other compositions, do not be afraid of you, and especially in wet diseases, since all doctors have been agreed on those, and they do not differ in the recommendation for cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and its goodness, since it is used in medicine as a burning agent, is because the fire is simple, the action of which only reaches the member that is cauterized and not to the other member attached to it unless by a small harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of medicine as a burning agent does not reach to that in the members which are attached to it, and therefore it is difficult for the disease to come into the affected member and it is rarely used.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	May the fire, due to its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, not do anything but superfluously; and we already know this through experience and the length of service in the study of the art over the truth of the causes; and for this reason he is excused from the length of the speech. If not for that, it would not have been read to you in this pause secretly by the fire, and the quality of the operation of it in the bodies and its expulsion by which it expels evils, the philosophical demonstrative sermon, which would be sharpened in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Know, children, that they should not be separated from the time in which it is appropriate to perform cautery and pause at the best time of primaveyra.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cautery is appropriate at all times, because the harm caused by the time accident is submerged in the benefit of that which is thrown with the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pain or necessary pain, quickly and forcefully, the ones that do not suffer delay because they fear those that come from evil, which is greater than small harm entering through the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And do not catheters in your feet, or sons, that is only estimated by the general people and foolish doctors, because that disease which is cured by cauterization is not always necessary, and they pause that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not always there that they fear for that, because cauterization is only in a place of medicine which alters the appearance and dries out the moisture which are the cause of why the pain comes.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But however, cauterization is used excessively in medicine for the sake of its value and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his disease returns in some time of the day, according to the appearance of the patient and the location of his disease, and its virtue, and that which is prepared in his body from the accumulation of excess in him, and that which is obtained by him in his acquisition of foods and similar causes; but the disease in which cauterization is administered is a subtle disease in a member of few superfluities and moisture, such as cautery for tooth pain and similar to that, possible it does not return that pain, but that which is done in small.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And more commonly spoken language is that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and rightly so, as they believe that there is no cure that can be achieved by means of medicine or any other cause that would require cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is in the opposite; and they understand that cautery is the last resort of medicine only when administering methods of treatment in some diseases, and those medicines do not work, and at the end of the cause, they administer homeopathic cautery, and it works for that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here it is understood that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not as they believe the common people and too many doctors think.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that gold is better than iron for cautery, and they did not say so only because of the equality of gold and the superiority of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for cautery does not hurt, as it is not absolutely true, because I have already seen that there are those who say that it only works in some bodies and not in others, and gold cautery is good and better than iron cautery; but however when you do gold cautery with fire, it is not up to you, as it depends on the amount of gold that you want according to the roughness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive the heat; and if you place it over the fire, the gold melts in the fire, and some pieces are created for the craftsman to use for that purpose.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for that purpose, we should use a pointed cautery made of iron, lighter and more conveniently placed at the right angle for the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter in the second chapter of the cautery, and have ordered those in the foot, so that when he asks for what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for pain in the head caused by cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery applies to the cold and moisture that cause this accidental condition, which is the cause of many traumatic fluxes, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the arms and legs, and many sleep disturbances, and toothache and stomachache, and generally all illnesses that come from cold, such as paralysis, drowsiness, and apoplexy, and similar in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first, commands the patient to take a laxative medicine to empty his head, for three or four nights, according to the patient's ability and age and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command the one who shaves his own head to hold the mirror between your hands and place your hands on his chest, holding them there.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the razor blade of your palm against the nose between his nostrils.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, as soon as you feel the location of the wound, mark that spot and then ignite the olive oil cautery of which this is the shape:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the location well-aimed, so that it slowly descends, and you gradually tighten the bandage, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then slightly lift your hand and look at the location, and if you see any quantity of bone exposed, as much as the quantity of grain, then lift your hand, and if it does not return, place your hand on that iron, or another of those, if it is cooled, before it is seen from the bone what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small pinch of salt and dissolve it on the location and leave that for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand on the flat side of the shovel and hold that over the entrance to prevent the embers from being destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the four-ingredient ointment into the wound to make it heal.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that as soon as the plague is opened, the arm becomes more painful and less useful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say that the armpit should be cauterized into the bone, and the cautery should be held there until some piece of the bone is attached.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove that which has been attached to the bone, and then heal it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach the back, until it breaks through the bone strongly before the bone rots, and this is the way to make a small incision:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate that from that wound, the fumes of the head come out.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then healed before it becomes solidified.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cautery used in all men, except in those who are second in line for fear; and let that one, I advise you, be better for their salvation when it is, because the head is developed by the solution of continuity of it with which we have testified in other members, and especially when the head of the patient is naturally free.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cautery is more saving and better for me; and from that one, you should choose the other work for salvation.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the head cautery.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the whole head there is chronic and long-lasting pain, and that is prolonged in the patient, and uses of garlics and of cochias and of capipurges and of emplaustres and of guatz and of cadels and of gualinas and of semblantz, and especially if it has already been cauterized by a cautery that they have and not appropriated to it any of those causes, then consider that if the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and not free and atroba mot gran freg, then that cauterizer should use another cautery instead of that one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then apply the pointed cautery on the surface of the head, entering through where the bone is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and discover the amount of the bone that we have found, and cauterize that with a pointed cautery in the part behind the head in the place where the sponge is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand away, and do not expose the bone, because the patient will suffer great pain different from all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will direct you to this location, because the pointed cautery that is used to cauterize the bones of the head and the occiput is more subtle than the one that is used to cauterize the middle part of the head; and this is the shape of it.
Capitol ters.	Third chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the ancient non-antique cauterization of the pineal gland.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain is felt in the part of the head, or pain spreads inside the skull, and other treatments have been administered and have not helped, then cauterization should be performed in two ways: either with a sharp cautery or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May a pointed cautery be used as a medical tool to remove a splinter from the hand, and then clean it with water and cover its extremities with ointment.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then incise the wound area on the temple with a blade that is entered into the place where it was made, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then apply strength to the stopped wound by pressing constantly, and leave it for three hours; and then remove the bandage and leave the wound open for two or three days, and then place a poultice on the side submerged in boiled water until the wound is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for it until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do so with some medical tools that I have written about in the other treatise on medical tools.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cauterization be done in this manner: light the cautery of which this is the shape:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a clawed cautery, because its head is shaped like a carnation in which there is some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a small pinpoint.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And place your hand over the painful area, and rotate the small iron at high speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of tissue that is stuck by the stick's sharpness is too much, lift your hand to prevent the artery from being stuck, so that no blood flows out.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And apply a salted water bandage to that area, and leave it for three days; then apply a soft bandage, and cure it with ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cauterize the end of the knife with a pointed cautery, and be careful not to cut the artery in this way.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of an old wound.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an old wound with the previous cure and the cure mentioned in the divisions of diseases, and if the cure does not improve it, and sometimes due to the disease that does not allow you to use the first pointed cautery or the fire cauterizer, then wait until the cauterizer becomes hot, as it means to place it over the painful area along a long line of the same length, or another; then place your hand firmly and strongly on that area where you are about to incise the skin and penetrate into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuity of the mandible, which is damaged by chewing, and that the jaw not be held tightly and the nerve that causes pain in that area, and that it does not become spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and care of blood flow from the artery that is abscessed, which is feared in its abscission, and more so for those who do not know what to do and are not skilled; and leave the operation in him at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And if you want to remember the regimen of blood flow from the artery after an accident, in its own place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this disease that does not allow this cautery and sees the patient's body tolerable, cauterize that in the middle of the head as we have reported, and cure the wound before it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter of stretching of the artery with a two-pronged cautery, and this is the best cauterization and more conformable.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cautery for treating gout pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain in the big toe occurs due to infiltration and is cured by laxatives and the other treatment mentioned in the previous section, but the pain persists, then ignite the cautery, and this is the one without punctures, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then bring the punctures close to the flame, and place them around the entire big toe as if it were a wheel, or in the circuit of each one if the pain is in each one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along with the cautery, gently apply it to the tip of the big toe as needed without hurting the area.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery of the points in the entire big toe is used, and it is found to be helpful, then cure the areas before they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cautery for treating torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture that is cured and cannot be treated by cauterization except for the specific ones that come from flexion, as we have mentioned in the sections on diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the specific area that causes dryness or spasms of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that area of torture with tinctures and capipurgi and guarguarismes, and do not compare your treatment, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first at the edge of the earlobe, the second a little below their temple, and the third at the conjunction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your hand on the opposite side of the affected area, as softening only occurs on the healthy side.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize that area with the cauteries at the edge of the earlobe, a little above the top of the cap, and in the temple another, the longest of which should be second to the length of the said point, and place your hand over the cauteries until the amount of the majority of the specific area of the code is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cauteries, and it is specific to the lancet, the shape of which is given in the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	May it still be less subtle than that one has with vessels; and cover that which is in the excess of grease with a cloth.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place where that process has taken place until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When ancient apoplexy is cured with that which we have said and does not conflict with your medicine and the patient does not have fever, then cauterize that place with four cauteries: over all of his head; and with a cauterizer and in the back of his head, as we have said; and with a cauterizer on his neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of the cauterizer is made according to what has been said.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and further back; and then cure that which has taken place.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of the cauterization of memory loss caused by a stroke.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	When the patient first begins to show signs of illness, give them large doses of medicine that will help them feel better.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the entire head of the patient and place a plaster made of the following description in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And place some of those, which are the handle of the cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do that second, as you have already described.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if those remedies are effective; and if not, then make three points on the back part of their head, which should be placed in the most superficial part of the head towards the back, and the least deep part of the head towards the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the largest part of the above between each point, and then cure the pointed cautery as you have already described.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you also feel it and the patient is able to bear it, then make the point in the middle location; and if you feel more pain, then apply the pointed cautery over the two toes.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Approach the wound that needs to be healed; and use the pointed cautery according to the shape given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of the perineum and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You have already processed in the softening of the head and that which we have said; and approach the head of the patient, and then cauterize that pointed cautery at the middle part of the head, and cauterize over all the bones of the head, and cauterize over the back part of it, and three cauterizations over the spines of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the patient's softening of the body of three such and those who can tolerate them, and the illness is strong, then cauterize that pointed cautery over the spines of the back, and afterwards cauterize through where the codena mot of it is located, and raise the tieua ma.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And approach the wound that needs to be healed; and this pointed cautery should be used according to the shape given.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of the cautery for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized, but that epilepsy is caused by humor.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore you should modify his brain at the beginning of his illness with hot and cold remedies, which we have said in the division when the patient is large and tolerates the exception of the medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate medicines, then administer gargarisms and mustard plasters to the same person who modifies him, giving that for several days, good nutrition.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then remove the patient's hair, and then cauterize that with a cauterizer in the middle of his head according to the previous method, and with another cauterizer in the back of his head, and on each ear of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates, then cauterize that with cauterizers which I have said, having paralysis and softening of the body over the spinous processes of the neck and the spinous processes of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use an olive-wood cautery as necessary.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	If the patient is a child, then use a thin cautery gently like this.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cauterization for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted by humid and flatulent humors, then cauterize those parts that we have mentioned in the book.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive and tends towards melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give them that which purifies their brain according to that which has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the head of the patient, and make a circular incision in an appropriate place on their head, and place your hand in the middle of that location.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be lying down and held by all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then place a liniment; and it is more worthy of being used as an ancient remedy for sheep.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that one over the fire, appropriately measured, which the suffering one says is enough when it is in them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place that one at the middle of their head, in a circle, and let it melt into them.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do that for the patient every week, following another regimen of food until they are healed; or if you want, make small points with the most appropriate cautery, but always have your hand on a cautery that is properly ordered: this is a special type of cautery that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that one on a soft cloth or in grayish wool.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the application of cold water to the skin.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared to you that the beginning of cold water on the skin, as I have mentioned in the division, then begin and give to the patient water that will make their head cool, and keep that one from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let that person bathe in warm water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then order that person to shave their head, and cauterize that pointed cautery at the middle of their head; and then cauterize that pointed cautery with two cauteries on two temples if it is the beginning of a headache in two hairlines, or with one if it is the beginning of a headache in one hairline.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut all the veins and arteries that are left behind the neck; and place those cauteries in that long area near the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And watch out for blood flow when it is cauterized; and if you see blood flow from it, stop the pointed cautery with some medicine that is possible for you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And bring some remedy that is in the extraction of arteries and the opening of those and the prevention of blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some veins are cauterized in the neck behind two bones with two cauteries previously produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of ancient cautery of tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears from the joints are very old and flow through the veins and arteries that are manifest in the location of the forehead and it is verified that this is excessive and fluctuating, then cautery that we have mentioned at the beginning of the chapter about water cascading in the joints, and cautery in the middle of the head and two cauteries on the neck below two temples, and two cauteries on the neck below two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if it is necessary to add, then cautery that one in the entire length of the hair on the end of the forehead with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of ancient cautery of the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that one who we have mentioned in the division and have not yet healed, then you should prepare and give to the patient the snuff for three nights; and then remove the head of it, and cautery with the middle cautery or olive oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then, using that pointed cautery, carefully cauterize the two points on the two upper corners just below the hairline.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that one.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is the shape of the pointed cautery.

Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	When the pointed cautery is used on the eyelid when the eyelashes are converted to the parts inside and prick the eyelid.

Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz. And then take some dry sawdust and fresh charcoal, and mix those with the ashes, and make that into a paste so that it is not scattered; and spread that paste on the paper that is made like a fan of myrtle, and place that over the wound; and place the other side of the wound in album of honey, and the head of the patient should be in the highest position.

E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the method of extracting bile.

Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc. E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is abnormal in the part where it is swollen.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then, you should cauterize the patient on the part of the ankle with a similar pointed cautery, so that you can properly apply it around the circumference of the part as it is rotated, and so that the part falls in the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the cautery that precedes this form is in the cautery of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not present to you, then use three pointed cauteries with large olive oil.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And the cautery should be made according to the amount of the swelling of the entire sinew; and care should be taken that it is healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the buttocks and its cause is coldness and moisture, the patient is cured by the method we have mentioned, and this method is ancient. Therefore, you should draw out the patient's heavy humors with fetid or artificial pills or similar ones; and then cauterize that.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The method of cauterization in this case has two ways: either with a cautery made of burning herbs, or with a cautery made of fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	The second method has two ways, of which one is to cauterize that over the buttock of the patient with three triangular cautery according to this form; and make them deep enough.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the space between each cautery be as much as the thickness of the patient's skin and if the cautery is olive oil or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Let some time pass before applying the cautery on the patient's head above the buttock so that there are four cautery.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena. E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the method of cauterization in the shoulder when pain adheres to the shoulder and does not extend into the space.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it extends into the space, then cauterize that one with two cauteries on the shoulder over the area where you wrap the patient who is suffering from pain; and with one cauteri on the back for a few minutes on the left side.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cauteri cuts, and the depth of the cauteri according to the quantity of the sinew of the shoulder.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient wraps that place where the pain extends into the area mentioned above the feet, then cauterize that one here with a pointed cautery for three or four or more points as needed from that one.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient wraps pain to be left behind the shoulder in the space, then cauterize that one here with a cutting cauteri.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be careful during the cauterization process that you do not leave the cauterizing instrument in place for too long as to burn the nerves or cause great damage, and that by doing so it may harm the patient.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have seen another case where they cauterized the scalp and left the cauterizing instrument in place during the procedure, and the bed on fire inflamed before the tumor was achieved, and fire pierced and corrupted the entire foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then apply a strong solution of vinegar, and then the patient died.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	If the pain is in two parts simultaneously, then cauterize each one in this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise men in the cauterization of any cauterizing instrument of which this is the manner: make it similar to a circle of iron of which the circumference is the length of one palm; and its opening should be according to the thickness of a date pit or a small amount.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let that circle be another third; and its space should be the thickness of a thumb; and those circles should be placed in two parts; and the length of those chains should be one or two fingers, and make them in those iron edges well dressed in the circles; and this is the shape of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Approach the fire until it becomes warm and produces sparks, and then place it on the patient's back, the patient lying on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And then cauterize that area with three pointed instruments in a row.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it like that for three days; apply ointment to that area and leave the wound open for several days; and then care for that area until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Dear sons, we have not used this type of cauterization for this kind of wound because of the fear of its side effects, and because we have found some that cause harm to it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	However, those who suffer from this kind of wound often find relief in the area where it is located.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	However, those who suffer from this kind of wound often find relief in the area where it is located. They do this by making two circles with a hollow needle that has a pointed tip, and then they insert the needle into the wound and move it back and forth, like a door hinge; the length of the needle should be equal to the width of their fingers.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	If the space between the patient's thighs is too wide, then it should be filled from below and above, and they should be positioned so that their second forms are like this:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then place your hand on the part of the body where the patient is lying, and cover it with your hand; and take water and pour it between two circles, and the quality of that water should be hot little by little, and let it stand for the quantity of an hour, and suffer the patient the bite and the adhesion of it — because that bite has the quality of fire — until the bite stops.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then raise your hand with the instrument and wipe off all the hot water with cold water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then leave it for three days and place your hand on that border until the blackness of the adhesion remains, and leave it for more days, and pour water over it; this is a remedy.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then heal it with ointment until it is cured.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain extends into the cushion or the bed, place it in the state where it contains water, as it is made in the bath equally.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method of the water cure, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the rectification of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe for alkalis and unextinguished fire from a single part, and draw the pieces in a new wave of which the broken part is previously perforated by a small tube, according to the amount that enters into it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place the other piece of the wave in another boiling water, and pour over it that alkalis and live fire of two waters which those take by a certain amount, and as soon as you understand those at the tieua main for good compression, and leave the wave that remains after the sharp water in the boiling water.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And adjust all that water, and pour it over another live fire and other renewed alkalis, as that is of a very strong heat, which is administered in certain medical operations and in cauterization of the other members, as that operation is of fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And some of the medicines are boiled in them, such as thyme and honey, which causes a sweet smell that is not known to be mixed.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	Guillia heard from an ancient man about the operation and cure that was done for the pain of gout and sciatica, and praised it as being very good, and said that there was no need for another cure, and that it was healed with a remedy such as this, which is to bathe in hot water.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it should be of certain fresh herbs, and if not fresh, then dried; and it should be crushed with a few grains of salt and placed on the water in which the pain is, or on the cushion, or on the chest, and left.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it should be left for the quantity of three hours or for as long as the patient can bear the heat.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then put that in the bath and when the body of the patient is wrinkled, take that out and put it on the ground, for the pain stops and is healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that no one should use this cautery for these medicines, but rather the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	According to Escorides, when there is a goat's wound and the vein is stretched, it should be cauterized with this method: take wool and soak it in old oil, and place it between the patient's foot and the wound.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take dry goat's wound and apply it to the area that has been cauterized with charcoal; and place it on the wool and leave it until it is stretched.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat that, and do not stop doing it until the sensation of pain reaches the whole body and the pain subsides.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this method of cauterization is called the cautery of goats.

De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	Of the cauterization of pain in two places.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Sometimes pain occurs in the two places due to various causes, such as by impact or by excessive evacuation, and by causes similar to those, by the infusion of moist and ground material.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And the cautery does not cut but only in this specific area that is made for the effusion of matter.

De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	Of cauterization at the beginning of gout.

De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament. Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of the cauterization of fractures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When the fracture is in the ankles and the intestines are pushed against the abdomen, and if it is approached, then order the patient to fast on that day and use mild cathartics so that the opening from their belly does not occur.

entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	so that it does not move and get cotton.

And then place the cautery over that one held by your hand and the cauterizer, and enter that one when you have obtained the bone of the pentenilh in the middle of the deltoid; and repeat that other action if you have not succeeded in the first action in obtaining the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe the position of the intestine during your cauterization, so as not to burn the patient because if it comes out under the patient, great harm may occur.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you use the cautery, do not hold the bone, do not perform your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And be aware that the cautery for children should be thin according to their size and age.

E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And be aware that the patient's food should be given according to the length of time for their treatment, which is appropriate for their belly, and that the intestine should not come out due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And when it is time to remove it after ten days, then administer soft food, and keep that for another ten days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And if they are tired from labor and food intake and drinking, and from violent vomiting, then this entire regimen of healing will cure them.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And if you want to cure the ruptures in other parts of the abdomen, and at the beginning, and so that they do not regurgitate, then cauterize the rupture with a red-hot iron according to the size of it, and this should be done with a clean part of it; and then care for that burn, and it should not be adjusted.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And they have already said that the rupture should be cauterized with a triangular iron according to this form, rather than with a tent.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor. De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On the cauterization of corroding.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corroding is a corrupting substance that moves within the body, which corrodes whatever it touches as if with fire, consuming dry wood.

Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incisions and perforations and bleedings and of phlebotomy and of plagues and their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are words of Albucasis.
