E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And I will begin by saying that you should know that in this chapter, son, I will tell you what is in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for that reason, son, I will tell you that in the operation which is in this chapter, there are many ways to evacuate the pus, which is very important for life, such as aspiration of the abscess or incision of the exit or purification of the plague or extraction of the stone or incision of the bone and similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all of these are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in the worst of them, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I will warn you that you should not do those things in which there is doubt, because some ways are due to the hands of men who have doubts about diseases.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And from them there are some that you will go to your disease and it will be due to death, and you will suffer from the severity of your disease, and from the length of your disease, and because of the fear of the disease which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And from those who give you their names and details, you hope for their recovery, and their illness is dangerous.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not consent to any one who comes to you with this method; and your caution should be greater than necessary, and your curiosity; and do not assume any cause of it unless you have certain knowledge that causes it to you, and to which successful succession brings praise.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the treatment of all your diseases prediction and indication of which is converted to health, because in that one is with you help over acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	O children, God breathes His understanding into you and does not lead you astray or protect you, because that is in His hands.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And you have ordered this chapter to be distinguished by chapters following the chapter of cauteries, of the cure of the head between the feet, so that it is joyful to you what you ask about it and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the treatment of gout that is contained in the head of infants.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	You should know that this disease affects children during infancy and when the newborn's head is soft.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some are caused by an unknown cause.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	I have never seen this disease except in children; and to all those that I have seen it was accompanied by death, and for this reason it is believed to be caused by something hidden.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	I have also seen that a child's head whose skull was full of water, and the skull of which was always inflated until it could not be inserted into its greatness, and more that the humidity increased until death.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity is added between the spine and the bone, or is added behind the bone on the skin.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	When the operation in that case where the humidity is between the spine and the bone and the abscess is small, then you should make an incision in the middle of the head at a certain latitude, and the length of the incision should be two fingers wide until the humidity flows out, and this is the shape of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And if the humidity is increased and the abscess is larger, then there are two incisions of this kind:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is below the bone, then you should open the commissures of the skull from all parts and pour water into it when you understand that your hand is in the middle and not on the parts inside and outside.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	So that you cut in the middle of the skull with three incisions of this kind:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And remove all the humidity from the incision; and strengthen the incisions with cloth and feathers; and apply that which is above on the fifth day, and remove the scab and cure the wound with ointments and balms, and strengthen the skull to its equality; and feed the patient with dry food after the member is comfortable and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another way of incision, which you should consider according to the size of the abscess and the collection of water, that sometimes it is more in the occipital region, or in the part above, or on the right, or on the left; and then pay attention to the incision where the abscess and the collection of water appear, and do that which is most possible.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not sever the artery and engage in bloodletting, as this may cause death for the patient due to excessive loss of fluid.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Regarding the incision of the arteries that are located near the ears, which are called temporal arteries.
Capitol segon.	Chapter II.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When a patient has cataracts or bruises on their thighs or chest, and this condition is recognized, and no healing is found in that, then the cure in this incision of those two arteries should be tried.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore cover when you want to incise those that the patient has on their head, and wipe the area with a rough cloth so that the vessels appear, and strengthen the collar of the patient with some cloth; and consider where the vein is placed; and the locations of each over the locations that are near the ears, and they are hidden in only a few people.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then press on the vessel and try to incise each one at the tip of each part until it reaches the bone, and that is for the length of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	If you wish, insert the spatula behind the artery and cut through that area to expose the parts above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And if the length of the incision is too short, then when a vein is cut, the blood will flow out, which should be stopped frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	If the bowel does not appear at the incision, then measure the amount of space between three fingers and gently insert the spatula into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And that amount of blood that flows out is usually one unit, and if it does not flow out more or less, then that is the amount that appears from the patient's virtue and the replacement of the bowel.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the cause of the swelling, and if there is some reason for abscess formation, then cut through that area to prevent it from becoming a pus-filled abscess.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then apply poultices and lint made of cloth to that area, and care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of extracting the spleen which is located in the belly.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When there are old, sharp stones or sharp objects in the abdomen, and pain is felt in the sides of the belly, and the pain is severe and similar to those, and it is not relieved by medical treatment, then we have found in these illnesses extraction of the spleen from the belly, or cauterization of those as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	The method of the operation and extraction of those is that the patient lies on their back; and understands the spleen which is in the belly, and sees it through its own pores, and it is hidden only in a few people due to its strong attachment.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden, then the belly of the patient should be strengthened with some cloth; and then the area should be scratched with a sharp knife or evaporated with hot water until the spleen appears clearly.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And at this time, you take the spatula of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you scrape the cornea with the sharp end until you reach the sclera; and then get in the eye and extract those from the superior parts until you extract the one from the cornea and discover that of the tunics which is left there, from all parts.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is thin, then wrap it with a piece of gauze at the end of the needle, and then incise one part according to the quantity by which its ends were stretched and contracted, and not too much, because if they are not incised, the blood will not flow out.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate the blood in drops until three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the sclera is large, then cover it with two pieces of gauze or with cotton strings long enough to prevent putrefaction during the healing of the wound and allow blood flow.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then incise the excess that is between two limbs; and do so at that hour or at another time.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	If you wish, use the pointed cautery to make points into the bone of the cautery, where the extramittents are inserted, and it will be in the place of that metessa work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	It is better to use the pointed cautery if the patient has fever or a scalded complexion; because the cautery is one of those causes that help to finish humidity, and therefore it is better in emergencies.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And cover the extraction of the archers that hump the place of the ancient cottage, and place them on clean linen, and then use dry medicines to heal the flesh and wet bandages until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And while you are doing another procedure to stop the flow of pus from the archer's wound, then you should tighten that pus, or the cautery, or what fills the place of the cottage, and press your hand inside until the pus is stopped.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of those causes is present, then place your hand over the location where the pus is congealed, and cover the location with very cold water until the heat subsides, and then tighten it according to what is appropriate.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And it is said that the most effective method for extracting bones from a carcass is to cauterize the vein with this cauterizer, which has two points, so that you can accurately feel the two places when they reach the bone and cut the vein into two parts, so that what is between the extremities of it is not consolidated by this cauterizer.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cauterizer:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the sharpness of the two points is as follows.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	However, if the sharpness of two points is not enough, it is better to use two points that are as sharp as two needles approaching each other, and do not dissect the flesh at speed.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, if there is any toughness in those places, the heat of the fire should be applied to them and the flesh should be cut away more easily.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better than all other works and more useful.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the space between the two points is equal to the thickness of the toughness of the said flesh.
Capitol quart.	Chapter fourth.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the treatment of bodies affected by sharp and acidic humors from the joints.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the acidic humors are in the body, and they affect the joints that are above the crown of the head, and there is no cause for healing in medicine, and the face of the patient becomes wrinkled and feels pain in their forehead as if they were walking with ants, and the joints of those are exhausted, humid and insensitive as if their flesh were known, and the scabs on them are scratched by the acidity of the tears, the ancient methods of treatment in the cure of these operations, and they name that cure "spread".
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you command the patient to shave the hairs that are on their forehead, and then incise three grooves equally spaced along the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	If the length of the groove is less than two fingers: the first groove should be equally distant from the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second along the length of a small movement of the eyelashes that are in the lacrimal, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And be careful of the edges of the jaws, which are in two layers, and extend your hand from the continuation of the gums to the lower jaw.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each joint is three fingers wide, adjust it accordingly.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a sponge or dry cloth, moisten it with the humor that dries the joint.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then place the spatula of two sharp ends, of which this is the shape of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the top of the temples to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape off all the tissue that is between two incisions on the periosteum, which is above the bone, and then do that from the incision further to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then place the spatula and enter the first incision another time with another instrument called a scalpel, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And place your hand on the sharp side of the flesh attached to the tissue, and on the other side of the bone, and push it until it reaches the second incision, and cut all the vessels that descend from the head to the feet.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	While continuing the incision at this point of the codex, and then do that in the middle groove between the other grooves.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when the amount of blood is equal, express the places of the patient's feet with a syringe.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place your hand on each groove of the old man's foot, and place your hand on those powders that are in vinegar and oil and vinegar, and see that it does not become an abscess.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, remove the bandage and administer a large amount of warm water or tea, and then care for that with an ointment made of basil icon and rose oil and other things until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	About the treatment of gallstones and the downward flow of the parts descending from the chapter.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When any vein is calcified and continuing, and sometimes the parts of the patient's eyes are weakened, and their eyelids are ulcerated and their eyelashes fall out, and in the front of the chapter there is sharp pain and consequent exhaustion, then you know that these materials and stones do not come from any other veins but those descending from the parts described.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for these is to order the patient to look at their own nose, and then insert a small blade into the middle of the forehead, near the temple (starting from the left temple and going towards the right temple; and the incision should go through the bone; and then stretch your hand over the temples which are swollen due to the mastigation), until it is through the bone.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry out all the pus with a sponge or dry cloth, and then fill it between the two lips of the wound at the old wound or with dry cloths.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then apply a clean cloth above the swollen area to prevent it from becoming an abscess.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the abscess has decreased, then insert a small blade into the area where it begins at the bone, and then apply the drying regimen which is made of flour and collyrium (four parts of each), and make an ointment from it and apply it to these wounds on the skin.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the treatment of that which catches in the fingers.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The entire cause that catches in the fingers is one of four species: either it is a mineral stone or a similar cause to a stone, such as iron and glass, or it is a plant cause such as hazelnut or bean, or it is a fluid cause such as water and vinegar and its similar substances, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when a stone catches in the finger or another similar cause to those causes that do not adjust or believe in the finger, and if the finger is exposed to the sunlight, and if you see the stone, then distill some oil of violent or sage onto it, and administer the extraction of it, and make the person sneeze in order to prevent the onset of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place some pieces of cloth or wool around the finger, and extend the finger to the parts above, because these are the parts that are often forgotten in these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	If it is not already done, then administer extraction of the stone using the instrument called the epicicloidal epithelial probe with this form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	If the stone is already extracted with the instrument, it is good; otherwise, then administer extraction of the stone using the thin needle of double puncture.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And then if it is not extracted by that, make a needle of aram and insert the end of the needle into the auditory canal and close around the needle with wax and softened oil so that it is not pushed out but only the needle.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract the stone with the suction device, which we have found to be very effective.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not extracted in this way, then take a hook or an old device that has been used to remove the eyelashes, and place a small amount of it on the end of the needle, and then cover that area with a clean cloth.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the auditory canal to facilitate, and then dry the ear from the moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And if all the causes that we have mentioned are not forgotten, then you should proceed to incise the part where the abscess or spasm occurred.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	The method for incising that part is to first sew the patient's vein of the saphenous and remove the suture according to the method of its virtue, and then make a small opening between your fingers and convert the wound edges upwards, and do not perform any deep incision in the area where the pain is most intense.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And if the opening is of lunar shape until it reaches the bone, and the bone is found, then use appropriate instruments to incise that part; and do so with the opening at that time with speed, and cure that part before it is healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause is one of the grasses that I have mentioned and is inflamed, then administer the treatment and extraction of it; but if it does not obey your instructions, then take a thin needle according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And apply that remedy to the patient who has fallen ill with that disease which is called gout in the earlobe.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not apply that remedy when you think that the patient has already been moistened by the vapor of the earlobe, and pause it over the affected area, and extract it with a needle or a subtle instrument, or at the beginning, as mentioned above, which is praised for its extraction.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	May the water that enters the earlobe be used as a sneeze conditioner at the beginning, and fill the patient's ear with an old cloth, and place a spoon over the ear in which the water is, and if it is removed by that, it is good; otherwise, take many small pearls according to the length of the mentioned one, and heat them in the fire for a short time, and the patient should put one of those pearls into the trachea of his ear and strike it with another pearl on the pearl inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore do not cease this remedy until all the water is boiled away.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when all the water is boiled away, take a piece of paper or cloth, and place one end in the ear and extend the other end into the fire until it is burned completely.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then place another cloth and make so many folds until all the water is boiled away, and then remove that which is below and is called the extraordinary stone of the remedy.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	In the extraction of beasts entering into that ear, if it is a small piece, use the same method as we have said in the division; but if it is a large piece that causes pain at the back of the throat, then administer the extraction of it with gestures and oncis, and the cause of it is the least of all the other causes that occur in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	In the extraction of worms that generate in the ear, when you treat that which we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations and do not compare your treatment, then cover the ear with a sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if here appears some cause of worms, then extract that sharp or thin instrument, but if there is no cause, then take a narrow needle and wide above it, of which this is the form of it:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And enter the thin end into the earhole according to the amount that can be tolerated by the patient; and then quickly pull out the other with strong force, and do so until all the worms are removed.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if they do not obey you with the instrument, then open and close it in the circuit of the candle as we have said; then administer distillations which have been used in the past in the treatment of worms, and look for that in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your effusion is the one that you pour into the earhole with this instrument, of which this is the form of it:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or copper, narrow, in which there is a small hole, and place it above.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so it should be used as needed in the cavity of the catheter here where it is necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the ray and wrap it in the end of the catheter decently, and then pour oil into the cavity of the catheter, or some herb, or whatever you want from these medicines in the catheter — and that is in the aurelha —, and then press the ray above and express the oil through your hand until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the catheter and the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And that which is in the aurelha should already have been heated by fire for a short time.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the cause which you will distill in the aurelha is not too cold, because the medicines of aurelha do not bear this.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the cure of opthalmia of aurelhas.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some people who are born from the wombs of unperforated mothers have already experienced this in some men, opthalmia in the meat of the aurelha by plague or by no flesh at all in that; and this opthalmia is sometimes made in the front of the trau of the aurelha which does not know the excrement, and sometimes in the parts in front.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And in the case of the patient who does not understand the language, it is in the most difficult situations for healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in the case where you succeed in understanding the language, cover the patient's ear with your hand and look at them.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if you see an ointment applied, open the small, sharp needle of this shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the end of it in which the width is small has one sharp part and the other not, and the needle is two lion widths long so as not to pierce the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the ointment is applied to the ear or to the meat of the patient, then open the small, sharp needles and insert them into that part with great ease before all the flesh is opened.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the ointment is applied to the front of the ear, then take a small, sharp needle and insert it into that part for a short distance, and then place it in the flesh of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And if the patient has difficulty breathing due to the weight of the abdomen, the effort of lifting it causes further difficulty in breathing; and be careful not to compress the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place a piece of cloth of the second quantity according to the width of the trachea, which you have wrapped around the groin Egyptian style; and do this for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the wound; or take any medicine and insert it into the abscess and powder it over it according to the triple method and use it; and if you see that the ear has already become infected, then remove the infection and replace it with another one that you have wrapped in a piece of greased wax, until the infection is cautiously cured; and then care for it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	If there is a flow of pus, then immerse a cloth or cloth in cold water and place it on the ear, and use another remedy that restricts the flow of pus, which is mentioned in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the care of atezil, which occurs in the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athezil, which occurs in the eyelids of some people due to a humid condition, and in others due to a dry condition.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, you should hold those eyes open or closed, and cut those eyelids from their roots, and place your hand over the areas according to the following.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	If the pain is caused by cold blood flow, then you should cauterize those eyelids with a fine cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to cut and scrape those dry areas when they return to their original state; and when they are cauterized with fire, those eyelids are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Of the care of greatworms, which occur in the eyelids of some people.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	They occur due to some cause in the eyelids of some people, which is similar to greatworms in their strength and hardness, and because of this, they are called greatworms.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And there is an accumulation of thick moisture under and above the eyelid.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation on them is considered if the large one comes out of that which appears from the eyelid and is moistened throughout; and the cause of it is unknown.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then make an incision over that with a sharp instrument to facilitate its exit, and then suspend it with a thread and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared for the incision of it and do not push it so that it does not penetrate the eyelid with the incision, then in no case will it be noticed.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with stitches; and cure it within that which is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, then it will not cause harm to that which the oil of it restores and envelops.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the large one declines towards the parts inside the eyelid, then open the eyelid and suspend it with a thread, another that you have chosen for incision, and press it throughout; and if the eyelid is lengthened by the incision, then in no case will it be noticed.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then, approach the beginning, wash the wound with salted water; and treat the area with what is inside that will heal it.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	About the treatment of eyelids above the wound.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axcirnath is gray matter that is produced in the tissues of the eyelid above, and mainly affects children, worsening their wounds and causing them to lose their sight; and they cannot see the light of the sun because tears gather in those.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you often see them talking to the corners of their eyes all the time, and to the corners of their eyes while they sleep; and those are the eyelids behind their brows, which have been covered by inflammation, and the appearance of pus is in the wound; and when you press the area with the tips of your fingers, you can feel the pus inside.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And sometimes the operation is performed on that person who lies on his back and places his head on the bed, and then place a cloth under him and over him, and make a circle according to the amount of pus contained in all parts, and then place that above it and press with the tips of your fingers from all sides so that the pus is accumulated in the middle of the circle, and then perform an incision in the middle of that humidity with a sharp instrument so that the wound does not become too large.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	In the first incision you make in the abdomen, go as deep as possible until you reach the peritoneum, where in the most dislocated processes, the peritoneum is usually cut according to the form of white goose.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then extract those clots that you have wrapped between the thighs, called parts of the uterus, and revolve them between your right and left hand until they are dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to push through the incision so that the sperm does not reach the bladder and the other falls away.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	If you do not find any sperm at the beginning of the incision, then push through the incision a small forceps until you reach the other; and then extract that which we have said; and underneath, moisten cloths with warm water and place them over the area and strengthen those wool pads.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And remember that they sprinkle salt and place it in the cavity of the incision to prevent that which is remaining from that moisture.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that which has been healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	If an abscess occurs in the area, then cure it with healing ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of the methods of touching the wound.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When the eyelids of wounds are not adjusted by their natural hairs and are antiquated, then touch those to the wound and make methods of evils as such with frequent tears and softening of the eyelids and cloth until that which is causing destruction of the wound, which is called tactinir of the wound, and cure it in four ways: either by cauterization with fire; or by acute medicine according to what is said in the chapter on cauterization; or it is done by incision and suture; or by cannulas as I have said.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore cover that you place the cap of the wound on your left hand; then convert the eyelid of the wound to your left hand, and if it is converted, it is good; and if not, insert a needle in the part where it is most likely to be near the edge of the eyelid, and let the needle penetrate above, and that which is on the edge of the eyelid, near the hairs, and pull the thread above to the palpebra, and convert it to the ray.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then insert a needle in the part of the eyelid behind the eyelashes, adjusting it with the incisors of the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor; and then remove the hair and place it behind the eyelid, covering it with small cotton or cloth, and then place a tent over the eyelid, and it should be as in the shape of a fan.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But it is important to note that the shape varies according to the degree of eyelid elevation, which differs among men, and those who require it to be incised from the eyelid by a large amount according to the amount by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then insert a needle in the two lines that you have sutured, and begin from the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is near the natural hairs, it should be as large as the largest of the king.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place the onion in one of the two corners of the coda, and then scrape it all, and then adjust the suture with the two lips of wool or thin wool, and remove the drainage, and make that which superfluously over the two eyelids stick to some causes enveloping, if you want to do that, and otherwise, don't care.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then remove the stitches from the wound after three or four days, and care for that area.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir. e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	and then you turn the eyelid and cut the figure that is hidden according to what I have said; and then make two thin threads of those that length should be according to the length of the eyelid and their width should be narrower than the width of the space.
